articles.title: Weight Loss by Intermittent Fasting Can Alter Your Brain Activity - Newsweek
articles.description: The "intermittent energy restriction" diet causes not only weight loss but also changes to brain activity and gut bacteria.
articles.content:
A popular diet regimen can cause permanent changes to both your brain and the bacteria in your gut, research has found.

articles.title: Vaccines reduce the risk of long COVID in children - Nature.com
articles.description: A study shows that US children who received mRNA COVID-19 vaccines have some protection against developing long-lasting symptoms of the coronavirus SARS-CoV-2.

articles.author: Neuroscience News
articles.title: Infant Brain Study Links Enlarged Brain Spaces to Autism Risk - Neuroscience News
articles.description: Researchers uncovered a potential early marker for autism in infants: abnormally enlarged perivascular spaces (PVS) in the brain.
articles.content:

articles.title: Researchers discover the weak points of the protein that causes one in 10 cancers - EL PAÍS USA
articles.description: Four scientists from Barcelona have created the first map of the vulnerable sites of the KRAS gene, whose mutations, often associated with smoking, cause millions of tumors

articles.title: Study: Colon cancer screenings are more effective than previously understood - MIT News
articles.description: Colon cancer screening is more effective than previously realized, according to a study by Josh Angrist and Peter Hull that looks at data from five trials.
